title: Express Talk: Time-Based Media
hero_caption: <p>Nam June Paik.<em>&nbsp;Untitled</em>, from The New York Collection for Stockholm, 1973. Gift of Robert Rauschenberg.</p>
description:
Explore what it means for a work of art to be "time-based" with Solveig Nelson, Mellon Curatorial Fellow in the Department of Modern and Contemporary Art. The discussion will consider how the legacy of film, video, performance and ephemeral art practices have transformed current collecting, exhibition and conservation practices.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.
